Forms

Use form elements to obtain user input. They should include text that describes the action they perform.

  1. Text Input
  2. Text Area
  3. Dropdown
  4. Radio Buttons
  5. Checkbox

1. Text Input

Size input fields to the text that needs to go in them. Don't make them too long or too short.

HTML goes here.
Angular example usage:
                
<app-textinput
    [isValid]="true"
    [inputText]="inputText"
    [validation]="inputFormControl"
    [invalidMessage]="'Email is invalid'"
>
</app-textinput>


Angular component:
                
import { Component, Input } from '@angular/core';
import { FormControl } from '@angular/forms';

@Component({
    selector: 'app-textinput',
    templateUrl: './textinput.component.html',
    styleUrls: ['./textinput.component.scss']
})
export class TextinputComponent {

    constructor() { }

    @Input() isDisabled: boolean;

    @Input() isValid: boolean;

    @Input() inputText: { value: string };

    @Input() validation: FormControl;

    @Input() invalidMessage: string;
}


Angular template:
                
<form>
    <div class="mat-input-text-wrapper">
        <mat-form-field
        class="material-text-input"
        appearance="outline"
        [class.disabled] = "isDisabled === true"
        [class.valid] = "isValid === true"
        >
        <mat-label>Input Label </mat-label>
        <input
            [disabled]="isDisabled"
            matInput
            placeholder="Email"
            [(ngModel)]="inputText.value"
            [formControl]="validation"
        >
        <mat-error class="error-message" *ngIf="validation.invalid">{{invalidMessage}}</mat-error>
        <span 
            *ngIf="isValid || validation.invalid"
            class="fa icon"
            [class.fa-check] = "isValid && !validation.invalid"
            [class.fa-exclamation] = "validation.invalid"
        >
        </span>
        </mat-form-field>
    </div>
</form>
Disabled
HTML goes here.
Angular example usage:
                
<app-textinput
    [isValid]="true"
    [inputText]="inputText"
    [validation]="inputFormControl"
    [invalidMessage]="'Email is invalid'"
>
</app-textinput>


Angular component:
                
import { Component, Input } from '@angular/core';
import { FormControl } from '@angular/forms';

@Component({
    selector: 'app-textinput',
    templateUrl: './textinput.component.html',
    styleUrls: ['./textinput.component.scss']
})
export class TextinputComponent {

    constructor() { }

    @Input() isDisabled: boolean;

    @Input() isValid: boolean;

    @Input() inputText: { value: string };

    @Input() validation: FormControl;

    @Input() invalidMessage: string;
}


Angular template:
                
<form>
    <div class="mat-input-text-wrapper">
        <mat-form-field
        class="material-text-input"
        appearance="outline"
        [class.disabled] = "isDisabled === true"
        [class.valid] = "isValid === true"
        >
        <mat-label>Input Label </mat-label>
        <input
            [disabled]="isDisabled"
            matInput
            placeholder="Email"
            [(ngModel)]="inputText.value"
            [formControl]="validation"
        >
        <mat-error class="error-message" *ngIf="validation.invalid">{{invalidMessage}}</mat-error>
        <span 
            *ngIf="isValid || validation.invalid"
            class="fa icon"
            [class.fa-check] = "isValid && !validation.invalid"
            [class.fa-exclamation] = "validation.invalid"
        >
        </span>
        </mat-form-field>
    </div>
</form>
Validated
HTML goes here.
Angular example usage:
                
<app-textinput
    [isValid]="true"
    [inputText]="inputText"
    [validation]="inputFormControl"
    [invalidMessage]="'Email is invalid'"
>
</app-textinput>


Angular component:
                
import { Component, Input } from '@angular/core';
import { FormControl } from '@angular/forms';

@Component({
    selector: 'app-textinput',
    templateUrl: './textinput.component.html',
    styleUrls: ['./textinput.component.scss']
})
export class TextinputComponent {

    constructor() { }

    @Input() isDisabled: boolean;

    @Input() isValid: boolean;

    @Input() inputText: { value: string };

    @Input() validation: FormControl;

    @Input() invalidMessage: string;
}


Angular template:
                
<form>
    <div class="mat-input-text-wrapper">
        <mat-form-field
        class="material-text-input"
        appearance="outline"
        [class.disabled] = "isDisabled === true"
        [class.valid] = "isValid === true"
        >
        <mat-label>Input Label </mat-label>
        <input
            [disabled]="isDisabled"
            matInput
            placeholder="Email"
            [(ngModel)]="inputText.value"
            [formControl]="validation"
        >
        <mat-error class="error-message" *ngIf="validation.invalid">{{invalidMessage}}</mat-error>
        <span 
            *ngIf="isValid || validation.invalid"
            class="fa icon"
            [class.fa-check] = "isValid && !validation.invalid"
            [class.fa-exclamation] = "validation.invalid"
        >
        </span>
        </mat-form-field>
    </div>
</form>
Validation error

Enter a valid email address

HTML goes here.
Angular example usage:
                
<app-textinput
    [isValid]="true"
    [inputText]="inputText"
    [validation]="inputFormControl"
    [invalidMessage]="'Email is invalid'"
>
</app-textinput>


Angular component:
                
import { Component, Input } from '@angular/core';
import { FormControl } from '@angular/forms';

@Component({
    selector: 'app-textinput',
    templateUrl: './textinput.component.html',
    styleUrls: ['./textinput.component.scss']
})
export class TextinputComponent {

    constructor() { }

    @Input() isDisabled: boolean;

    @Input() isValid: boolean;

    @Input() inputText: { value: string };

    @Input() validation: FormControl;

    @Input() invalidMessage: string;
}


Angular template:
                
<form>
    <div class="mat-input-text-wrapper">
        <mat-form-field
        class="material-text-input"
        appearance="outline"
        [class.disabled] = "isDisabled === true"
        [class.valid] = "isValid === true"
        >
        <mat-label>Input Label </mat-label>
        <input
            [disabled]="isDisabled"
            matInput
            placeholder="Email"
            [(ngModel)]="inputText.value"
            [formControl]="validation"
        >
        <mat-error class="error-message" *ngIf="validation.invalid">{{invalidMessage}}</mat-error>
        <span 
            *ngIf="isValid || validation.invalid"
            class="fa icon"
            [class.fa-check] = "isValid && !validation.invalid"
            [class.fa-exclamation] = "validation.invalid"
        >
        </span>
        </mat-form-field>
    </div>
</form>

2. Text Area

Use a text area when the user is expected to enter in a larger amount of text.

Standard textarea

Tell us about yourself

HTML goes here.
Angular example usage:
<app-textarea [textareaText]="textareaText"></app-textarea>

Angular component:
                
import { Component, Input } from '@angular/core';

@Component({
    selector: 'app-textarea',
    templateUrl: './textarea.component.html',
    styleUrls: ['./textarea.component.scss']
})
export class TextareaComponent {

    constructor() { }

    @Input() textareaText: { value: string };
}


Angular template:
                
<div class="mat-textarea-wrapper">
    <mat-form-field appearance="outline">
        <textarea
        matInput
        placeholder="Textarea"
        [(ngModel)]="textareaText.value"
        ></textarea>
        <span class="resizer-arrow-wrap">
        <span class="resizer-arrow"></span>
        </span>
    </mat-form-field>
</div>

3. Dropdown

Use dropdowns to contain large numbers of options or when space is at a premium.

Select option

HTML goes here.
Angular example usage:
<app-select [options]="selectOptions" (changed)="logSelectChanged($event.value)" ></app-select>

Angular component:
                
import { Component, ViewChild, Input, Output, EventEmitter } from '@angular/core';
import { MatSelectChange } from '@angular/material';

@Component({
    selector: 'app-select',
    templateUrl: './select.component.html',
    styleUrls: ['./select.component.scss']
})
export class SelectComponent {

    constructor() { }

    @ViewChild('selectComponent') selectComponent;

    @Input() options: OptionValue[] 

    @Output() changed = new EventEmitter();

    handleChange($event: MatSelectChange) {
    this.changed.emit($event)
    }
}

export interface OptionValue {
    value: string;
    viewValue: string;
}


Angular template:
                
<div class="select-wrap">
    <mat-form-field appearance="outline">
        <mat-select
            #selectComponent
            panelClass="material-select-panel"
            (selectionChange)="handleChange($event)"
        >
            <mat-option *ngFor="let option of options" [value]="option.value">
            {{option.viewValue}}
            </mat-option>
        </mat-select>
        <span
            class="fa"
            [class.fa-chevron-down]="!selectComponent.panelOpen"
            [class.fa-chevron-up]="selectComponent.panelOpen"
        >
        </span>
    </mat-form-field>
</div>

4. Radio Buttons

Use radio buttons for simple questions with only two or three options.

Linear

Would you like to sign up to our newsletter?

HTML goes here.
Angular example usage:
<app-radio [isColumn]="true" ></app-radio>

Angular component:
                
import { Component, Input } from '@angular/core';
import { MatRadioChange } from '@angular/material';

@Component({
    selector: 'app-radio',
    templateUrl: './radio.component.html',
    styleUrls: ['./radio.component.scss']
})
export class RadioComponent {

    constructor() { }

    @Input() isColumn: boolean;

    handleChange($event: MatRadioChange) {
    console.log($event)
    }
}


Angular template:
                
<div class="radio-wrap">
    <mat-radio-group
        [class.is-column]="isColumn"
        (change)="handleChange($event)"
    >
        <mat-radio-button value="1">Option 1</mat-radio-button>
        <mat-radio-button value="2">Option 2</mat-radio-button>
    </mat-radio-group>
</div>
Stacked

What's your favourite colour?

HTML goes here.
Angular example usage:
<app-radio [isColumn]="true" ></app-radio>

Angular component:
                
import { Component, Input } from '@angular/core';
import { MatRadioChange } from '@angular/material';

@Component({
    selector: 'app-radio',
    templateUrl: './radio.component.html',
    styleUrls: ['./radio.component.scss']
})
export class RadioComponent {

    constructor() { }

    @Input() isColumn: boolean;

    handleChange($event: MatRadioChange) {
    console.log($event)
    }
}


Angular template:
                
<div class="radio-wrap">
    <mat-radio-group
        [class.is-column]="isColumn"
        (change)="handleChange($event)"
    >
        <mat-radio-button value="1">Option 1</mat-radio-button>
        <mat-radio-button value="2">Option 2</mat-radio-button>
    </mat-radio-group>
</div>

5. Select box

Use select boxes to allow users to select more than one option from a small group, or for opt in/out questions.

Stacked

When do you tend to browse the web?

HTML goes here.
Angular example usage:
<app-checkbox></app-checkbox>

Angular component:
                
import { Component } from '@angular/core';
import { MatCheckboxChange } from '@angular/material';

@Component({
    selector: 'app-checkbox',
    templateUrl: './checkbox.component.html',
    styleUrls: ['./checkbox.component.scss']
})
export class CheckboxComponent {

    constructor() { }

    handleChange($event: MatCheckboxChange) {
    console.log('checkbox changed', $event)
    }
}


Angular template:
                
<div class="checkbox-wrap">
    <mat-checkbox
        (change)="handleChange($event)"
    >Check box</mat-checkbox>
</div>
Single checkbox
HTML goes here.
Angular example usage:
<app-checkbox></app-checkbox>

Angular component:
                
import { Component } from '@angular/core';
import { MatCheckboxChange } from '@angular/material';

@Component({
    selector: 'app-checkbox',
    templateUrl: './checkbox.component.html',
    styleUrls: ['./checkbox.component.scss']
})
export class CheckboxComponent {

    constructor() { }

    handleChange($event: MatCheckboxChange) {
    console.log('checkbox changed', $event)
    }
}


Angular template:
                
<div class="checkbox-wrap">
    <mat-checkbox
        (change)="handleChange($event)"
    >Check box</mat-checkbox>
</div>
